feature.name: Martial Archetype: Impractical Weaponry (HB)
feature.text:
The Impractical Weaponry Fighter is a master of turning the ordinary into the extraordinary, wielding any object with lethal efficiency. With abilities that allow them to adapt quickly to the chaos of battle, disarm, shove, or grapple foes, and even stun opponents with an unexpected strike, these fighters are unpredictable and resourceful combatants, capable of turning the tide with whatever's at hand.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 10 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Bonus Proficiencies (Impractical Weaponry (HB))
feature.text:
At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with improvised weapons. Additionally, you gain proficiency in the Sleight of Hand or Acrobatics skill, enhancing your knack for quickly adapting to any combat situation with whatever items are at hand.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 10 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Improvised Might (Impractical Weaponry (HB))
feature.text:
Also at 3rd level, your unarmed strikes can deal 1d4 damage, and any attack made with an improvised weapon deals 1d6 damage at least. This damage increases to 1d8 at 7th level, 1d10 at 10th level, 1d12 at 15th level, and 2d12 at 18th level. Additionally, you can spend a bonus action to analyse your immediate environment and designate one object within 30 feet as your Improvised Weapon of Choice. For 1 minute, attacks with this designated improvised weapon gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 10 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Anything Goes (Impractical Weaponry (HB))
feature.text:
At 7th level, once per turn, when you attack with an unarmed attack or improvised weapon, you can use a bonus action to attempt to disarm, shove, or grapple the target in addition to the attack. You must decide which of these additional effects you are attempting before making the attack roll.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 10 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Adaptive Combatant (Impractical Weaponry (HB))
feature.text:
Starting at 10th level, you refine your ability to utilize your surroundings in combat. You can now designate up to three objects within 30 feet as your Improvised Weapons of Choice for 1 minute, and attacks with these weapons gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls. You can draw or pick up these weapons as part of the attack action, demonstrating your mastery over the chaos of battle.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 10 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Master Improviser (Impractical Weaponry (HB))
feature.text:
At 15th level, your attacks with improvised weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. Furthermore, once per turn when attacking with an improvised weapon, you can reroll the weapon's damage dice and choose which roll to use.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 10 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Unpredictable Assualt (Impractical Weaponry (HB))
feature.text:
At 18th level, once per encounter per creature, when you hit a creature with an improvised weapon, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier, whichever is higher). On a failed save, the creature is stunned until the end of your next turn, caught off-guard by your audacious attack.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 10 (Homebrew)
